comments.text:
User Agent:  

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open testcase.
2. Shift-click with left mouse at link #1.
3. Cancel or allow PDF Dialog/Viewer.


Actual results:

New window has empty URL


Expected results:

Show URL in address bar.

comments.raw_text:
Open test.pdf in new window: test.pdf

This is the result I obtain with Fx 8, Fx 3.6 and Konqueror. It OK that you get a blank page when you click at the test.pdf link. It's not OK that the address bar of the new window is blank.

comments.text:
The Preferences setting on Virgil's machine is unclear, I asked: 'What is your settings in Preferences/Applications/Content-Type=PDF? Here it is "always ask"'.

With "always ask" I can reproduce the issue in Firefox 28. When it is set to "preview in Firefox" the URL is presented.
comments.author: kdevel@vogtner.de
comments.creator: kdevel@vogtner.de
comments.raw_text:
The Preferences setting on Virgil's machine is unclear, I asked: 'What is your settings in Preferences/Applications/Content-Type=PDF? Here it is "always ask"'.

With "always ask" I can reproduce the issue in Firefox 28. When it is set to "preview in Firefox" the URL is presented.

comments.creator: standard8@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Confirming as this is a valid bug - it happens when the setting is "Always Ask" and the test case is shift-clicked.

I think this is more likely tabbed browser related than address bar, as the address bar just displays what it is told, and this works for opening in a new tab, but not in a new window.
comments.author: standard8@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Confirming as this is a valid bug - it happens when the setting is "Always Ask" and the test case is shift-clicked.

I think this is more likely tabbed browser related than address bar, as the address bar just displays what it is told, and this works for opening in a new tab, but not in a new window.
